text: - I actually wasn't doing anything,
just looking for different jobs.
- My background was hospitality.

- I didn't really know as far
as which way I wanted to go.

- I worked for a corporation
that had a number of layoffs.

One of the options that
came was an opportunity
to go back into teaching.
- I got interested into the cloud

because I was looking for
something that would be
more pivotable towards a new career.
- When I told my mom about cloud,
she was like what are you doing,
what are you learning, what's cloud?

- Technology changes and
morphs itself all the time.
We're seeing more and more importance
of organizations making use of cloud.
We have shortage of individuals
that can fill some of these rolls.
And one of the most important things

is being willing and adaptable
to change and to learn.
- You can tell when he teaches
he's really passionate about what he does.
- We want them to be encouraged to expand

on that training and pursue
additional certifications

and prepare for roles
in cloud support arena.

- I am going for the
solutions architect position.

- Using my brain as
opposed to using my hands.

- We don't see a lot of
people that look like me
in an IT field, and I'm grateful

for having the opportunity
to share knowledge

that I have with the next
generation who looks like me.
(gentle music)
